intro: Phyllanthus heteromorphus, commonly known as the variable phyllanthus, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, Asia, and Australia. It is a shrub or small tree that typically grows to a height of 1–3 meters, characterized by its opposite, simple, and often lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in clusters, followed by small, round fruits that contain a single seed. It is adapted to thrive in well-drained soils and is often found in dry or semi-arid environments. The species is also known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
